title: Exponential Distributions
text: We want to find find $$P\left(4<x<5\right)$$. Use the CDF function on a calculator to find the area between $$x=4$$ and $$x=5$$\n##figure1.gif##

title: Exponential Distributions
text: You can find the area to the left of $$x=4$$ and find the area to the right of $$x=5$$ to get the complementary probability of $$P\left(4<X<5\right)$$.

title: Exponential Distributions
text: A simple calculation of can also be done: The probability that a postal clerk spends four to five minutes with a randomly selected customer is P(4 < X < 5) $$=$$ P(<P(X < 4) $$=$$ 0.7135 - 0.6321
